(A)

Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, the land use commission shall act on
an application for a variance not later than the next meeting after the public hearing
is closed.

(B)

The platting board may:

(1)

approve an application for a variance;

(2)

approve an application for a variance with modifications; or

(3)

deny an application for a variance.

(C)

The platting board may require that a variance be:

(1)

revocable;

(2)

effective for a specified time period; or

(3)

subject to one or more conditions.

Source: City Code Section 25-1-215; Ord. 031211-11; Ord. 031211-42.

(A)

Except as provided in Subsection (B), a decision on a variance is effective immediately.

(B)

If a variance is appealable, a decision on the variance is effective either:

(1)

at the expiration of the time period during which an appeal may be filed; or

(2)

if a notice of appeal is filed, when a final decision on the appeal is made.

Source: City Code Section 25-1-216; Ord. 031211-11; Ord. 031211-42.
